thread.title_full: Trump Shrugs Off Disagreements, Says Cabinet Picks Told To ‘Be Yourself’

author: Jack Davis
title: Trump Shrugs Off Disagreements, Says Cabinet Picks Told To ‘Be Yourself’
text:
“I could have said, ‘Do this, say that.’ I don’t want that. I want them all to be themselves,” he said. 
That the nominees hold views different from Trump’s is not a surprise to the transition team. 
Incoming White House spokesman Sean Spicer said the team conducted 35 mock hearings with nominees, covering 75 hours and calling for 4,712 questions. 
Trump comes to the presidency after a successful career as a real estate developer and CEO of the Trump Organization. Along the way he shared two comments that reflect the style Trump has used, in which disagreement is a step to decision-making. 
“A visitor in my office once mentioned that the goings-on there reminded him of a family fight in progress,” Trump wrote once. “I will admit that the volume level gets high now and then, and he wasn’t far off in his assessment. But if you want smooth sailing every day, move to the Mediterranean.”
